channel.title: Lets talk monies
channel.description:
monies is fun right
i joined RSCA to improve it back when it was F2P. i then realised how much money KO9 was bringing in, so i asked for a little taste of this delicious monies. i kept wanting more and more, then eventually i was only writing code for the monies. if i was lucky i'd get $800 a month (and i thought that was decent)
part of my absence from this community has been simply because i decided to get off my ass and get a job.
i now work as a systems technician & network administrator getting 1.2k a week. i can do the job fine too.
it's funny because i didn't finish grade 10, did no college/uni or any other shit, . from age 15-21 i just sat home and played PC games and taught myself computers over that time.
few weeks after looking for a job i landed this great job and life is good. RSC shit is well behind me, or though i wouldn't mind playing from time to time (the only real reason im hanging around here, is to play mopar rsc)
point i am trying to make here is: don't bother making shit in this community if your looking for money, the real world is much better.
unless, your names peyton who runs an old WoW private server, racking in a nice 100 grand a month before getting sued.

item.title: Lets talk monies
item.dc:creator: @Jython super_
item.description:
@Jython wrote:

[quote=“Crooks, post:13, topic:410637”]xEnt; How did you get that job? without an education?

in Sweden where I live, you can’t get a single job without an education. … But maybe except if you have skills, I don’t know:)

Congratulations to your new job anyways![/quote]

In Sweden, being social democratic, there is practically no reason for one NOT to get an education.

Read full topic

item.title: Lets talk monies
item.dc:creator: @adu adu
item.description:
@adu wrote:

One of my co-workers who is currently in his late 30’s never graduated from high school and has been working for the company since he was 18 years old. To land the job I currently have now, I had to do 2 years of Engineering technology in collage just to get in with the company.

So I guess its just a matter of luck, no one actually needs the education as long as you can prove on site that you know what your doing.

Edit: Now that I think about it some more, its not about luck. Its about how you present yourself.

Read full topic

item.title: Lets talk monies
item.dc:creator: @Crooks Crooks
item.description:
@Crooks wrote:

What I really mean is that here in Sweden you have to have an education in order to get a job (unless you have contacts ofc). It does not matter how good you are at things… they always check how it went through your schooling.

And this is wrong, i think they should look how experienced you are.
I mean, what if someone has an education, the highest ratings in all. But that guy is worse than the one that does not have an education?
The system is bullshit. xD

Read full topic
